1 -Existence d’un programme intégré de réforme du secteur de la justice 2. - Nombre de rapport trimestriels produits à partir d’Atlas, après mise à jour régulièrement des résultats des activités. 3 - Existence d’une stratégie de coopération internationale 4 - Existence d’un bulletin de coopération 5- Nombre de chargés de programme qui disposent des connaissances en suivi des projets en Atlas 6 - Nombre de Newsletter produits

comment.narrative: 1 -Aucun programme intégré n’existe 2 -Aucun rapport de projet extrait d’Atlas. 3 -Inexistence de stratégie de coopération 4 - Le dernier bulletin a été produit en 2000 5 - 10 Chargés de Programme sont concernés 6 - Aucun Newsletter est produits actuellement

description.narrative: I. Number of men with access to legal aid services II. Number of women with access to legal aid services III. Number of magistrates stagiaires definitively appointed IV. Existence of library at CENFOJ V. Existence of a mechanism of pending cases update VI. Existence of thematic report on compliance of judicial decisions with domestic legislation and international

comment.narrative:
I. 3106 men (figures updated on 31st December 2013) have been assisted with free legal aid in the Capital of Bissau and 3 Regions (Oio, Cacheu and Bafata)
II. 852 women (figures updated on 31st December 2013) have been assisted with free legal aid in the Capital of Bissau and 3 Regions (Oio, Cacheu and Bafata)
III. 13 magistrates stagiaires are not definitively appointed
IV. No library at CENFOJ
V. Lack of updated data on pending cases in the Courts
VI. Lack of mechanism to assess the compliance of judicial decisions with human rights standards

I. 6800 people benefited from free legal aid services in Bissau and regions II. 37 magistrates stagiaires are definitively appointed in Courts of Bissau and Regions III. A data system is established and functioning IV. 2 Sector level courts in Cacheu and Mansoa Regions constructed and operational

I. Achieved: 8466 people benefited from free legal aid services in Bissau and regions II. Partially Achieved: 14 intern magistrates were definitively appointed in Courts of Bissau and Regions III. Not Achieved: A data system is established and functioning (this expected result has not been achieved) IV. Achieved: The Two courts were constructed, equipped and handed over to the Government. One is already operational

I. 8.813 people benefited from free legal aid services in Bissau and regions. II. 30 people attended the in-take career course of clerks at CENFOJ III. 16 magistrates trained IV. A database system is established and functioning V. A study on efficiency and effectiveness of justice service delivery is available VI. One performance evaluation of magistrates VII. One training on fight against corruption

description.narrative: Strengthening adaptive capacity and resilience to Climate Change in the Agrarian and Water Resources Sectors in Guinea-Bissau (PIMS 3977)-FSP

title.narrative: Climate change PRODOC page of signature
RFP/PNUD/GNB/003/2016 - Audit des projet HACT -NIM/NGO/- LTA

description.narrative: The ultimate development objective to accomplish is to ensure that high level policies and management plans relating to agriculture and water sectors explicitly consider climate change risks and opportunities.
independent political entity
To increase resilience and enhance key adaptive capacity to address the additional risks posed by climate change to water and agriculture sectors in Guinea Bissau
1 High level policies and management plans relating to agriculture and water sectors explicitly consider climate change risks and opportunities

comment.narrative:
The following policies plans are not climateproof
National Plan of Agricultural Investment PNIA
National Program on Food Security
Water Directive Water Code
Poverty Reduction Strategy II

At least two high level policies National Plan for Agricultural Investimment Region Gabu Local Plan Development Water and Sanitation Policies National Plan Livestock development management plans explicitly consider climate change risks and opportunities

Significant progress has been made towards the achievement of this DO target i 40 keys cadres from 16 keys line ministers have acquired knowledge on climate change mainstreaming methodology and have actively participated in the application of the methodology integrating CC issues into the target policy documents and plans Agricultural Development Policy Letter Water and Sanitation Master Plan Livestock Development Policy Letter National Strategy for Poverty Reduction and Gabu Region Local Development Plans Piche and Pirada administrative sectors These documents have been revised integrating climate changes issues following the validation workshops held in Bissau and Gabu Is expected that by the end of the year this policy documents and plans will be adopted by the Government

description.narrative: 2Government and international funding allocated to managing climate change risks increased

comment.narrative: lt25000 USDyear
At least 100000 USDyear

The project team National Project Coordinator Agricultural Specialist and Climate Change Adaptation Specialist has provided assistance to the Government in its partnership with a West African Development Bank BOAD for a project proposal formulation on climate change adaptation in amount of 10000000 USD to the Board of Adaptation Fund before end of the year b European Union under Global Climate Changes AllianceGCCA funding for formulation of project proposal on adaptation and mitigation to climate in order to strengthen the resilience of communities of the Bafatá Gabu Quinara and Tombali regions This project is in its final stage and the planned funding are of 4 million euros and is virtually guaranteed This project will strengthen the adaptation initiatives envisaged under the current NAPAResilience project in the Gabu region
UNDP CO and Regional Technical Advisor have provided technical support to the Government in the elaboration of a 125 million USD project proposal on climate change adaptation in coastal area and a 5 million USD project proposal on early warning system development The adaptation project was approved but as LDCF is exhaust therefore these two projects are under reformulation seeking GCF funding
Within the framework of partnership with the Directorate General of Livestock the Government through Monetary Union of West Africa UEMOA has provided 25000 USD for the vaccination of cattle against carbuncle hematic and symptomatic Also under the same framework 25000 USD were invested in the construction of 4 veterinary clinics 1 small slaughterhouse and 1 butcher shop in some of the project targeted villages in Gabu Region
These two initiatives will support the achievement of the target under this DO

description.narrative: 3 Scores of UNDPs Vulnerability Reduction Assessment VRA to be applied upon inception midterm and endofproject in projectsite communities

comment.narrative: As of results after the application of the tool at project inception
Aggregate reduction of 1035

The exposure to the risks are the same but the vulnerability of the communities has decreased thanks to increase of awareness on climate change issues and the adoption of sustainable solutionstechnologies such as cereal banks fodder plants cultivation resilient agricultural techniques improved wells for water adductionpumping etc during the reporting period the following has contributed for strengthening the communities resilience to climate change i draft report identifying keys national actors suitable to address climate risks management and proposing a Commitment Plan for climate risks management to be signed by all of them is available ii 10 Contingencies Plans for 10 villages are developed and adopted iii four 4 national technicians have acquired knowledge on climate change risks and vulnerability analysis and mainstreaming methodology through a training course provided by a Burkina Faso Specialized Training Institute v the Rural Forum on Climate Change and the Environmental Surveillance Committee has met quarterly and promoted awareness campaigns on Ebola Virus Disease deforestation implications in climate change need to preserve their natural heritage through a participatory and holistic approach

description.narrative: Climate change risks and adaptation measures integrated into key national policies plans and programs for water agriculture and livestock resource management
1 High level policies and management plans relating to agriculture and water sectors explicitly consider climate change risks and opportunities

comment.narrative:
The following policies plans are not climateproof
National Plan of Agricultural Investment PNIA
National Program on Food Security
Water Directive Water Code
Poverty Reduction Strategy II
At least two policy frameworks relevant for the agriculture and water sectors effectively incorporate climate risk consideration and adaptation measures

This DO is in good trend for its accomplishement 40 national technicians from key ministries trained on UNDP climate change mainstreaming methodology revised and preliminary mainstreamed climate change issues into Agricultural Development Policy Letter Water and Sanitation Master Plan Livestock Development Policy Letter and Gabu Region Local Development Plans Pitche and Pirada administrative Sectors 239 students from different schools in Gabu region sensitized on climate change issues

description.narrative: 2 Number of key agencies having taken institutional measures to respond to climate change through capacity building and mainstreaming activities

comment.narrative: Currently only SEADD hence 1 agency
MADR MEIRN NMI has the capability and enhanced implementation and planning of the program and projects on climate change

The project support to the Government has contributed to i strengthen the capacity of the National Institute of the Meteorology INMGB in the field of data processing and dissemination of meteorological information ii improve INMGB capacity to provide meteorological assistance supportive to various social and economic activities namely agricultural production activities iii enable NIMGB to participate and profit from the World Meteorological Monitoring programme VMM and iv create a scientific basis for an early warning system development v two 2 NIMGB cadres trained in Praia Cape Verde on Geographical Information Systems to strengthen the GIS Laboratory in process of operationalization This Laboratory also has received too equipments from the SEMA System of Environmental Monitoring in Africa Project in complementary basis

description.narrative: 3 Percentage of end users utilizing climate risk information from seasonal climate forecast systems in decisionmaking

comment.narrative: No current seasonal climate forecast system is in place Once in place for at least 6 months a baseline in terms of potential and actual endusers will be set
Results of the seasonal forecast and its integration into farming practices are available

Synoptic and climatological stations of Bafata and Gabu inaugurated
Response kits delivered to operationalize of contingency plans in 10 villages project sites
The pluviómetre peasants continue to play their roles giving relevant information to farmers about the soil humidity
Two local community radios continue to emit radio programs about meteorological information The Radio Sol Mansi with national coverage has issued awareness programs radio nóvelas in three national languages creolo fula and mandinga in order to sensitize the general population about causes consequence climate change impacts and adaptation measures
A total of 10 Contingency Plans were prepared for 10 villages Were delivered the kits for rapid response for the implementation of Contingency Plans in these 10 villages
Performed more than 10 ten awareness campaigns in which they were sensitized about 400 people in villages on the operationalization of the Contingency Plans drawn up in 10 villages of the project whose objective aims to train teams to answer the possible calamities of natural disasters
Formed 19 literacy teachers and animators among which 2 are women about the use and implementation of literacy teachers manual Literate of literacy participants in 14 project villages sites were 331 214 are women on different themes Conducted and presented a theatrical piece play about the problems of climate change and mitigation measures in the 9th FRAC session

description.narrative: Lessons learned and best practices from pilot activities are disseminated and integrated in national plans and policies
1 Percentage of stakeholders being targeted for awarenessraising activities affirming ownership of adaptation processes

comment.narrative: NA stakeholders to be targeted for awarenessraising activities will be defined upon inception
50 over the baseline

The synergy with other projects involved area could be bring more impact change and transformation in communities to strengthen their adaptive capacity to adverse effects of climate change To maximize use of the holes is required near the holes are constructed with the respective troughs to serve not only for human consumption but also for animal Given the financial difficulties widely known an important lesson was taken the will to continue to work prepare documents required for achieving the objectives set for the various products It is possible to save capitalize upon the financial resources of the projects as well as expand the area of competence of the same by creating synergy with other project stakeholders which would be beneficial for the people The successful introduction of new technologies in agriculture depends on the strategy used that is must be accompanied by incentives to the agricultural inputs and materials There is a great desire on the part of peasants trained to replicate the new techniques of resilient adaptation to climate The need to expand the tuning fork of new technologies in the agricultural sector agriculture livestock and water management for farmers and creators of the project area and surrounding This extension depends on the strategy used that is must be accompanied by incentives to the agricultural inputs and materials

description.narrative: 2 Number of contributions to the Adaptation Learning Mechanism ALM

comment.narrative: 2 per year

With the constant updating and improving the project Web site interface wwwalteracoesclimaticasgborg the establishment of the first BO they were distributed 1000 copies whose contents causes and consequences of climate change and mitigation measures of its effects and the issuance of radio novel and radio programs of the project the project communities begin to learn best resilient adaptation techniques to climate change and now have information on the benefits of its application They are shared several success stories both in terms of agriculture as the feed level eg introduction of forage spices Brachiaria Several success stories are filmed and will soon be made available to UNDP

description.narrative: Small and medium scale climate change adaptation practices for agriculture water and livestock resource management are demonstrated and implemented in selected regions
1 Average agricultural productivity of key crops kg ha measured at site level in pilot demonstration fields showing improvements compared to national andor regional average for Gabú

comment.narrative: National andor regional Gabú average agricultural productivity for key crops to be applied as baseline for comparison
Increased the average yield of cereal crops dried sorghum black corn corn Bacillus etc approximately 200 kg ha pampam and bas fond rice of approximately 200300 kg ha

Formed 44 people 22 women and 22 men of the Management Committee of water points in 11 locations Built 6 drinking water supply wells 6 animators trained in the techniques of determination of crop yields through square installation Animators have used this knowledge in installing 53 square in 53 agricultural fields Of these 17 were cultivated fields of traditional form and remaining through new techniques Initiated the hidroagricola management in Padjama Canquelifa Iancor Cuntim Formed and recycled a total of 361 farmers in agricultural producers about the cultural climate resilient techniques of which 58 are women about 3258 Have been installed 30 demonstration fields practice 025 x 025 ha being 13 of Zaï 10 of crop rotation and 7 transverse field The average yields were 2348 kgha for rice 1293 kgha for corn 1572 kgha black maize and 940 kgha for peanuts Conducted 5 awarenessraising campaigns and information to communities about the use of excreta for the production of organic fertilizers and producing alternative energy source In this campaign form 150 people that sensitized 80 are women Trained 183 farmers in climate change resilient techniques Finished the stake of approximately 546 hectares of land to practice agriculture Sensitized 1350 new cattle breeders in which 619 are women on the importance of brachiaria cultivation

description.narrative: 2 Food security in pilot villages as a result of the effective uptake of technologies and techniques introduced by the project

comment.narrative: As per WFP data for selected villages among target sites
Guaranteed food availability increased by at least two more months

Finalized the construction of 8 seedscereal banks with a storage capacity of 25 tons each in 8 villages Cuntim Camalidja Padjama Canquelifa Bajocunda Patchana and Copa Mangui for storage of cereals and seedsSensitized 743 creators of cattle of which 125 are women about animal nutrition and importance of hangars Formed 55 creators of cattle on the family cattle management Formed 100 creators in animal housing techniques its advantage in dairy and meat production Built 23 hangars with storage capacity of 3277 ton 1425 tonhangar for storage of hay for livestock feed in the critical period February to June being 16 in 14 projects villages and 7 in the neighbouring villages Harvested 600 kg of seeds of brachiaria in 27 fields installed the 24 villages are very common Collected 50000 kg of dry straw of brachiaria in 27 fields and stored in hangars 7000 kg of dry straw harvested and stored in hangars built for the purpose Produced and distributed 6 tons of organic fertilizer 12 tonnes per village by bovine waste recovery

description.narrative: 3 Water availability at the level of households that are benefitting from pilot measures to improve water management litres day inhabitant over time

comment.narrative: Not available target households for improved water management are not yet established
Availability of 20 liters of water head day over time

Inhabitants of 14 villages project sites have access to clean drinking water by building 14 water points 11 modern and improved wells 3 holes This water availability is extensible to the animals that they have water in quantity and quality thereby improving the public health situation All these 14 villages have management committees of water spots composed essentially by women

The project will provide technical and financial assistance to develop the tools and instruments for beneficiary technical structures and ensure the training of a critical mass of executives capable of managing development. The learning approach will be developed and followed to ensure the transfer of knowledge and know-how. The project will also contribute to the creation of a supportive and stimulating environment for greater labor productivity. Good practices at the regional and international levels will be transposed to raise the standards of functioning of institutions to acceptable level

description.narrative: Local Governance and Development Project reinforces capacities to develop regional planning system, formulate regional and local development plans sensitive to gender and environment, promote decentralization in Gabu, Cacheu and Qunara Regions.

activity-description.narrative: Strengthening local planning and development capacities in the Gabu, Cachéu and Quinara regions.

description.narrative: 1. Existence of the national and regional planning, monitoring and evaluation system 2. Existence of integrated capacity building programme for regional planning, monitoring and evaluation system 3. Number of community consultative bodies established and promoting transparency and accountability in local public affairs 4. Number of people trained in new planning systems in Regional and Sectorial Planning Cabinets 5. Number of Sectorial Development Plans sensitive to gender and climate change developed 6. Number of Regional Development Plans sensitive to gender and climate change developed 7. Existence of Regional and Sectorial micro-financing schemes that enhance the business opportunities 8. Existence of value-chain financing facilities that supports local development

comment.narrative: 1. No regional planning, monitoring and evaluation methodology in place 2. Inexistence of a capacity building programme on regional planning, monitoring and evaluation 3. 0 4. 0 5. 0 6. 0 7. No micro-financing schemes in place 8. Non existence of value-chain financing facilities that supports local development

1. Regional planning, monitoring and evaluations planning methodology evaluated and validated 2. Capacity building programme formulated and approved 3. 0 4. 05 national cadres trained to be trainers of the new planning methodology 5. 0 6. 0 7. 01 concept note on local economic development, including micro-financing scheme promotion, formulated and submitted for funding 8. 0

1. Regional planning, monitoring and evaluations planning methodology was developed and endorsed by the government 2. Capacity building programme for trainer of trainers on regional planning, monitoring and evaluation formulated and endorsed by the government 3. 0 4. 07 national cadres trained to be trainers of the new planning methodology 5. 0 6. 0 7. 01 concept note formulated and submitted for funding 8. description.narrative: Appui à consolidation de l’Etat de droit et de la gouvernance démocratique fondée sur la participation citoyenne, le renforcement des Institutions républicaines et de la Société Civile (PACID)
Appui à consolidation de l’Etat de droit et de la gouvernance démocratique fondée sur la participation citoyenne, le renforcement des Institutions républicaines et de la Société Civile (PACID)
capital of a political entity
Elections - elections

1. Extent to which Democratic Governance institutions (Parliament, CSOs and EMB) play their oversight roles (0-4) 2. Extent to which population, especially women and youth, participate in political and policy decisions that affect their lifes (0-4);

comment.narrative: La Guinée –Bissau est confrontée au désintérêt croissant des populations pour la gestion publique, et à la faible participation effective du plus grand nombre aux prises de décisions stratégiques pour le pays, ce qui constitue de fait une entrave majeure à la gouvernance démocratique.

1. Révision de la législation et le fonctionnement de l'ANP (Règlement intérieur, les statuts de carrière des fonctionnaires parlementaires et des règles interne du Conseil d'administration du Parlement) 2. Les rapports sur les actes de corruption dans l'exercice des activités public disponible 3. Capacité du personnel du Parlement est renforcée pour améliorer le fonctionnement du Parlement 4. Renforcement des capacités de l'ANP dans les domaines du contrôle et de la supervision des actions du gouvernement qui tiennent compte de la perspective de genre 5. Les organismes de gestion des élections ont des capacités pour assurer des processus efficaces, transparents, participatifs et électoraux crédibles qui sont sensibles au genre 6. Les institutions publiques et les organisations de la société civile ont la capacité de budgétiser, de définir un cadre de gestion et mettre en œuvre des politiques sensibles au genre qui répondent aux priorités du public.

1. Les capacités de l’ANP sont renforcées dans les domaines de la représentation, de la législation, du contrôle et de la supervision des actions du Gouvernement qui prennent en compte une perspective de genre. 2. Les organes de gestion des élections ont la capacité d’assurer des processus électoraux efficaces, transparents, crédibles et représentatifs ouverts à la participation des femmes. 3. Les institutions publiques et les organisations de la société civile ont la capacité de budgétiser, de définir une structure de gestion sensible au genre et de mettre en œuvre des politiques qui répondent aux priorités du public
